question: [File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: insert_coin_activities()] [Event sequence manipulation] The primary key includes event_sequence_number - can an attacker manipulate event sequences to create collisions that mask legitimate withdrawals or deposits? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: insert_coin_activities()] [Gas fee activity collision] Given that gas fee events use BURN_GAS_EVENT_CREATION_NUM (-1) and BURN_GAS_EVENT_INDEX (-1), can an attacker create legitimate events with these values to collide with gas fee records? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: insert_coin_activities()] [Chunking division] At line 131 using get_chunks, if CoinActivity::field_count() returns 0 or a very large number, can this cause division by zero or incorrect chunking leading to failed inserts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: insert_coin_activities()] [Batch ordering] If coin_activities array is not sorted by primary key, can the do_nothing() conflict handling cause non-deterministic behavior across different indexer runs? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: insert_coin_activities()] [NULL field handling] If any fields in CoinActivity contain NULL values when do_nothing() is triggered, does PostgreSQL handle this correctly or could it cause constraint violations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: insert_coin_infos()] [Version rollback attack] At lines 162-176, the WHERE clause at line 175 only updates if transaction_version_created >= EXCLUDED.transaction_version_created - can an attacker exploit this to prevent coin info updates by creating early low-version fake coin info? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: insert_coin_infos()] [Metadata manipulation] At lines 165-174, all coin metadata (name, symbol, decimals) is updated on conflict - can an attacker update a legitimate coin's metadata by creating a transaction with higher version number? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: insert_coin_infos()] [Supply aggregator replacement] At lines 171-172, supply_aggregator_table_handle and supply_aggregator_table_key are updated - can an attacker redirect supply tracking to a malicious aggregator table causing incorrect supply calculations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: insert_coin_infos()] [Hash collision] The conflict key at line 162 is coin_type_hash - can an attacker find two different coin types with the same hash to cause one coin's info to overwrite another's? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: insert_coin_infos()] [Timestamp manipulation] At line 170, transaction_created_timestamp is updated - can timestamp inconsistencies across nodes cause different indexers to have different coin creation times? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: insert_coin_infos()] [Version comparison bypass] The WHERE clause comparison at line 175 uses >= instead of > - can an attacker with equal version number overwrite existing data even though it's not actually newer? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: insert_coin_infos()] [Decimal manipulation] At line 169, decimals field is updated - can changing decimals break existing balance calculations that depend on the original decimal value? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: insert_coin_infos()] [Creator address spoofing] At line 166, creator_address is updated based on version number - can an attacker claim to be the creator of an existing coin by creating a higher version entry? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: insert_coin_balances()] [Historical balance tampering] At lines 193-194, the composite key (transaction_version, owner_address, coin_type_hash) with do_nothing() prevents updates - can an attacker replay old balance states by creating entries that block newer balance records? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: insert_coin_balances()] [Balance snapshot race] If two indexers process overlapping transaction ranges, can do_nothing() conflict resolution cause one indexer's balance records to be silently dropped? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: insert_coin_balances()] [Version-based ordering] Since the primary key includes transaction_version, can out-of-order transaction processing cause balance history to be recorded incorrectly? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: insert_coin_balances()] [Chunking consistency] If a single transaction creates balance changes across multiple chunks due to get_chunks splitting, can partial chunk failures cause inconsistent balance history? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: insert_current_coin_balances()] [Balance rollback vulnerability] At lines 213-221, the WHERE clause at line 221 uses <= comparison - can an attacker with an equal last_transaction_version overwrite the current balance even though it's not actually newer? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: insert_current_coin_balances()] [Amount manipulation] At line 216, the amount field is directly updated without any validation - can an attacker craft transactions that set arbitrary balance amounts bypassing Move VM validation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: insert_current_coin_balances()] [Version comparison race] If two concurrent transactions have the same last_transaction_version, can the <= comparison at line 221 cause non-deterministic balance updates depending on which executes first? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: insert_current_coin_balances()] [Timestamp inconsistency] At line 218, last_transaction_timestamp is updated - can timestamp manipulation cause the indexer to show incorrect 'last updated' times for balances? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: insert_current_coin_balances()] [Composite key collision] The conflict key (owner_address, coin_type_hash) at line 213 uses hash instead of full coin type - can hash collisions cause one user's balance to overwrite another user's balance for a different coin? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: insert_current_coin_balances()] [NULL amount handling] If amount field is NULL or negative due to BigDecimal arithmetic errors, does the update at line 216 accept invalid balances? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: insert_current_coin_balances()] [Concurrent updates] If multiple indexer processes update the same (owner_address, coin_type_hash) simultaneously, can the WHERE clause at line 221 cause lost updates due to race conditions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/processors/coin_processor.rs] [Function: insert_coin_supply()] [Supply history tampering] At lines 239-240, the composite key (transaction_version, coin_type_hash) with do_nothing() prevents updates - can an attacker block supply updates by inserting dummy records at future version numbers? (Medium)
